body_html:
Hi @jihunchoi , thanks for pointing this out!

Yes, it is because tf.convert_to_tensor changes the RNNCell to a tensor. I assume the reason why we use tf.convert_to_tensor was because the user might supply a numpy matrix instead.

I thought about your solution as well, but I found it overengineering the data structures from the RNNCell. Instead I removed the tf.convert_to_tensor. Your code should run just fine now.
body_text:
Hi @jihunchoi , thanks for pointing this out!
Yes, it is because tf.convert_to_tensor changes the RNNCell to a tensor. I assume the reason why we use tf.convert_to_tensor was because the user might supply a numpy matrix instead.
I thought about your solution as well, but I found it overengineering the data structures from the RNNCell. Instead I removed the tf.convert_to_tensor. Your code should run just fine now.
body:
Hi @jihunchoi , thanks for pointing this out!

Yes, it is because `tf.convert_to_tensor` changes the RNNCell to a tensor. I assume the reason why we use `tf.convert_to_tensor` was because the user might supply a numpy matrix instead.

I thought about your solution as well, but I found it overengineering the data structures from the `RNNCell`. Instead I removed the `tf.convert_to_tensor`. Your code should run just fine now.
